title: Ginsburg sides with conservative justices in ruling over prison sentence
content:
The Supreme Court on Monday found that a criminal defendant can be sentenced for violating his supervised release , even if the release expires while he is incarcerated ahead of facing new charges .
The justices , divided in the 5-4 decision , ruled against Jason Mont 's argument that a district court should n't be able to charge him for violating his release because the term had expired at the time of the new sentencing .
